newsitem.title: USA: Haddon Heights, N.J., splits vote on school bonds.
newsitem.headline: Haddon Heights, N.J., splits vote on school bonds.

text.p: Voters in Haddon Heights, N.J., approved one school bond referendum Saturday and rejected a second in a narrow election, a school official said Monday.
Voters approved a $2.3 million question for classroom and window renovations by a vote of 718 to 658.
But they defeated a second proposal, totaling $1.5 million, to make a local high school comply with regulations regarding disabled access. That vote was 691 to 687.
Election officials said a preliminary count on Saturday showed the second question had won approval, but absentee ballots counted since then put the measure down to defeat.
